page.title: 07LANDSCAPE
page.content: This area being so close to the shores of Lough Neagh is fairly low lying sloping gently towards the Lough in the West. The average height of the land is around 50 feet above sea level. The maximum heights of 80 feet above sea level are in the Northern and Southern portions of the area and the lowest heights of 30 feet are found in a strip running across the middle of the region. This is to be expected since the main{river}of the region, the Six Mile Water flows through it. Although most of the land is gently sloping there are some embankments of Glacial origin in the west of the area.
